intro: Chaetanthera acheno-hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy-fruited chaetanthera, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its fruit is a dry, hairy achene, which aids in seed dispersal. It is often found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and forest edges.
